code_quality.details: Clean structure with routes/database separation. Swagger jsdoc inline docs. No eval, no debug endpoint, no hardcoded secrets. Proper HTTP status codes (201, 404, 422). Husky + commitlint enforce commit conventions. .env.example present. Minor: toObj/toArray helpers duplicated in routes file instead of shared module.

documentation.details: Excellent README with CI/CD badges, setup instructions, env vars table, endpoints table, project structure, Docker instructions, and Swagger link. Swagger UI active at /api-docs with full OpenAPI annotations on every route.

teams.summary: Solid project with good CI practices (husky, commitlint, dependabot). Clean code, well-documented API. One of the more polished repos.
tips: Extract toObj/toArray helpers into a shared utils module to avoid duplication
Name your PRs with conventional commit format (feat: xxx, fix: xxx) — squash merges use the PR title as the commit message
Consider adding a global error handler middleware for uncaught route errors

code_quality.details: Good separation with helpers.js extracted. No eval in search. /debug endpoint exists but guarded by NODE_ENV=development. Proper try/catch in POST route. CodeQL and Dependabot configured. Minor: console.log in root endpoint, app.listen inside module (not guarded for testing in a clean way).

documentation.details: Good README covering features, stack, security tools (CodeQL, Trivy, Dependabot, SonarCloud), installation, Docker, and local security scan instructions. Swagger UI active at /api-docs with OpenAPI annotations on all routes.

teams.summary: Decent project with good security tooling (CodeQL, Trivy). Code is clean with helpers properly extracted. Debug endpoint guarded but still present.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — even with NODE_ENV guard, it exposes SECRET_KEY and API_KEY if env is misconfigured
Remove the console.log('someone hit the root endpoint') — it adds noise to production logs
Add a .env.example with descriptions of each required variable

code_quality.details: Good use of helmet() for security headers. eval() removed from search (comment confirms). Global error handler present. Clean app structure with require.main guard. .env.example present. Minor: toObj/toArray duplicated in routes, comment '// test-deploy-01' left in database.js (dead code), variable named 'x' in GET route.

documentation.details: README is essentially empty — just 'a todo api' with npm install/start. No API docs, no endpoints listed, no env vars, no badges, no Docker instructions. No Swagger configured.

teams.summary: Code quality is reasonable with helmet and proper error handling, but documentation is critically lacking. The README tells nothing useful about the project.
tips: Update your README with real setup instructions, API docs, and badges
Add Swagger/OpenAPI docs — Express can use swagger-jsdoc + swagger-ui-express
Remove the '// test-deploy-01' comment in database.js and rename variable 'x' to something meaningful

code_quality.details: No eval — search uses parameterized query. /debug endpoint guarded by non-production check. knip configured for dead code detection. release-please for versioning. formatTodo/formatTodos functions are verbose (could use object spread). console.logs in database.js. Minor: productionLazyImport pattern is unusual and potentially confusing.

documentation.details: Good README with badges, install/run/test/Docker instructions, full API endpoint documentation with request/response examples. swagger.json with Swagger UI at /docs. No env vars section beyond PORT.

teams.summary: Good project with thoughtful tooling (knip, release-please). Debug endpoint guarded. API well documented in both README and Swagger.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — even behind a non-production guard, it's a risk if NODE_ENV is unset (defaults to exposing secrets)
Remove console.logs from database.js — use a proper logger or remove them
Simplify formatTodo/formatTodos using object destructuring instead of manual key assignment

code_quality.details: Clean, minimal code. No eval, no debug endpoint, no hardcoded secrets. Proper HTTP codes. Prettier configured. Separate server.js entry point. Minor: no try/catch error handling on routes, no global error handler, toObj/toArray not extracted to utils, no .env.example.

documentation.details: README is essentially empty — 'a todo api' with npm install/start. No API documentation, no endpoints, no env vars, no badges, no Docker instructions. No Swagger configured at all.

teams.summary: Code is clean but minimal — no error handling, no API docs, no Swagger. README is the default placeholder. Needs significant documentation effort.
tips: Update your README with real setup instructions, API docs, and badges
Add Swagger/OpenAPI docs — Express can use swagger-jsdoc + swagger-ui-express
Add a .env.example file so others know which env vars are needed

code_quality.details: Modern ES modules setup. Clean code with consistent style. /debug guarded by NODE_ENV=development. esbuild for bundling. vitest for testing. Scalar API reference instead of classic swagger-ui. .env.example present. compose.yml for Docker. Minor: console.logs in routes ('created todo', 'found N todos') should use a logger.

documentation.details: Excellent README (6KB) with CI/CD badges, table of contents, prerequisites, getting started, env vars table, running tests, Docker pull/build, complete API reference with all endpoints documented including request/response formats, and CI/CD pipeline description. Swagger UI active at /api-docs.

teams.summary: One of the best projects. Modern tooling (ES modules, vitest, esbuild, Scalar), excellent documentation, clean code. Very thorough README that actually helps someone set up and use the project.
tips: Replace console.log calls with a proper logging library (pino, winston) for structured logs
Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — even with NODE_ENV guard, it exposes secrets if env is misconfigured
Consider adding input validation (e.g., zod) for request bodies

code_quality.details: Excellent code quality. Zod validation on all inputs (create, update, pagination, search). helmet() for security headers. morgan for logging. express-rate-limit for rate limiting. CORS properly configured via env var. Request ID middleware for log correlation. No eval, no debug endpoint. Proper error handler middleware. All routes wrapped in try/catch with next(err). release-please for versioning. pnpm. No dead code.

documentation.details: Comprehensive README with CI badge, setup instructions (clone/install/env/run), env vars table with defaults, Docker instructions, available commands, API endpoints table, Swagger UI at /docs. Extremely detailed Swagger annotations with multiple examples per endpoint, validation error examples, and schema references.

teams.summary: Top-tier project. Input validation with Zod, security hardening (helmet, rate limiting, CORS), request tracing, comprehensive error handling. Documentation is exemplary with detailed Swagger examples. The most production-ready codebase.
tips: Consider adding a health check that also verifies database connectivity
The Swagger annotations are very thorough — consider extracting them to a separate OpenAPI YAML to keep route files focused
Add a .env.example with comments explaining each variable's purpose

code_quality.details: Multi-environment .env support (.env.production, .env.staging). Swagger via docs/swagger.js. Proper try/catch on all routes. SECRET_KEY and API_KEY loaded but unused (dead code). todo.db committed to repo (should be gitignored). .env.production and .env.staging committed (potential secret exposure). console.logs in routes.

documentation.details: Good README with badges, stack info, installation steps, scripts, endpoints documented, curl examples, Swagger link, CI/CD description, and deploy URL. Swagger UI active at /api-docs.

teams.summary: Decent project with good README and Swagger. However, committed .env files and todo.db are concerning. Unused variables suggest incomplete cleanup.
tips: Move secrets to environment variables (.env) — never commit .env.production or .env.staging with real values
Add todo.db to .gitignore — database files should not be in version control
Remove unused SECRET_KEY and API_KEY variables from app.js — they're loaded but never used

code_quality.details: JSDoc comments on all route handlers with param descriptions. swagger.json for API docs. Proper try/catch on all routes with 500 error responses. k6 load testing script. Vercel deployment config. Minor: console.logs in routes, variable 'x' in GET /todos, no .env.example, console.log in root endpoint.

documentation.details: Good README with CI/SonarCloud badges, features list, stack description, installation, test commands, Swagger documentation, and CI/CD pipeline explanation. Swagger UI at /api-docs.

teams.summary: Good project with comprehensive CI pipeline (lint, test, Docker, Snyk, SonarCloud, Vercel deploy). JSDoc comments add value. k6 for load testing is a nice touch.
tips: Add a .env.example file so others know which env vars are needed
Remove console.logs from production code or replace with a proper logger
Rename variable 'x' in GET /todos to something meaningful like 'todos'

code_quality.details: Zod validation on create and update with clear error messages. Swagger jsdoc annotations. .env.example present. .trivyignore for known CVEs. PR template for consistent reviews. perf-check script. require.main guard. No eval, no debug endpoint. Minor: console.logs in routes, search uses String() cast (good defensive coding).

documentation.details: README has good CI/CD badges and describes lint, test, secret scanning, vulnerability scanning, deployment hooks, and SonarCloud setup. However, it's still light on API documentation — no endpoint table, no request/response examples. Swagger UI at /api-docs compensates partially.

teams.summary: Strong CI/CD implementation with Trivy, Gitleaks, SonarCloud. Zod validation is a great addition. README could use more API documentation to complement Swagger.
tips: Add API endpoint documentation to the README — even a simple table helps
Name your PRs with conventional commit format (feat: xxx, fix: xxx) — squash merges use the PR title as the commit message
Consider adding a health check that returns uptime and version info

code_quality.details: Well-structured with utils.js extracted for formatTodo/formatTodos/toArray. Extensive JSDoc on all functions. Swagger via YAML file. /debug returns 404 in non-dev (good). handleRouteError for consistent 500 responses. docker-compose for dev and prod. Prettier configured. Vercel deployment. .env.example. Minor: formatTodos could use .map() instead of for loop, toObj null-checks in todo.js but not in utils.js.

documentation.details: README has badges and covers setup, structure, endpoints, scripts, and contributing guide. However, the content is duplicated (entire README appears twice!). No env vars documentation. Swagger UI at /api-docs with YAML spec in docs/swagger.yml.

teams.summary: Good code quality with proper extraction of utilities, consistent error handling, and thorough JSDoc. README is decent but the duplicated content needs fixing.
tips: Fix the README — the entire content is duplicated (appears twice in the file)
Add environment variables documentation to the README
Simplify formatTodos to use .map(formatTodo) instead of a manual for loop

code_quality.details: Modern ES modules. Clean separation with helpers/utils.js for toObj/toArray/formatTodo. Swagger jsdoc with proper OpenAPI annotations. Renovate for automated dependency updates. .env.example present. No eval, no debug endpoint in production. jest.config.js with coverage. Minor: console.logs in routes, no try/catch on most routes (only POST has implicit error handling via Express).

documentation.details: Comprehensive README with badges, technology table with versions, detailed local setup steps, env vars explanation, scripts table, project structure, Docker deployment with GHCR pull command. Swagger UI at /api-docs with full annotations including schemas.

teams.summary: Well-polished project with modern tooling (ES modules, Renovate), clean code structure, and excellent documentation. One of the more complete repos.
tips: Add try/catch error handling to all route handlers — currently only POST has it
Replace console.log calls with a proper logging library
Consider adding input validation (e.g., zod) for request bodies
